channel.title: Add new items to your server! (317)
channel.description:
This Tutorial is for begginers and im just helpin out so don't Flame!
Difficulty 1 out of 10
Tutorial made by Z Rowt21
First you will need to go to the models section of moparscape and find/download a model that you like.
Once you have your model downloaded save it on your desktop.
open your client files and go to class8.java [sup]Search for class8.aByteArray178 [/sup]
Now under class8.aByteArray178 you will see a "}"
Paste the ints for your model you just downloaded under the "}" and save and exit.
now go to your models folder and drag your model's Zips (drop file and wield file ) into the folder. Now go back and compile.
Now go into your source and open items.java or item.java and if your modell is a plate body look for all the platebody ID'S and put your item's ID into that list.
now save and compile and re run your server
log in and type ADD MODELS or ::ADD MODELS or ::MODELS or MODELS or anything of that sort
It should lag out and now your can type ::pickup (####) (####) or ::item (####) (####) your item and WALAHHHHHH you successfully added a custom to your server
If this was easy for you comment below :)
For an amazing RSPS go to www.nitro-scape2.webs.com TRY IT OUT!!

item.title: Add new items to your server! (317)
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

There is already a HUGE tutorial on moparscape about adding models. We don’t really need this, plus it’s kinda messy and unexplained.

Thanks for contributing though

EDIT: Remove your server link, advertising isn’t allowed.

Read full topic
